alert.note: Alert for Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 5:28PM CDT until October 27 at 2:38AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Isolated flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, San Jacinto, Trinity and Walker. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across portions of the area. Additional rainfall is expected over the next few hours, which could result in isolated flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntsville, Trinity, Groveton, New Waverly, Riverside, Sebastopol, Huntsville State Park, Oakhurst and Crabbs Prairie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
